name: cell
content:
cell noun [C]
(ORGANISM)
Add to word list
Add to word list
B2 the smallest basic unit of a plant or animal
Callista Images/Image Source/GettyImages
Examples
The fission of the cell could be inhibited with certain chemicals.DNA is stored in the nucleus of a cell.The baby is still just a small bundle of cells.The doctors discovered cancerous cells.

cell noun [C]
(ROOM)
B2 a small room with not much furniture, especially in a prison or a monastery or convent
PaulFleet/iStock/Getty Images Plus/GettyImages
Examples
Cooped up in a small dark cell, the prisoner hadn't seen daylight for five years.He was bound and gagged and left in a cell for three days.Immured in a dark airless cell, the hostages waited six months for their release.Brody was locked in a padded cell and forced to wear a straitjacket.
